bibdata.title: Cleanup the recap$ locations and set the Alma recap_edd flag  correctly

comments.body:
Based on the updated file that @mzelesky provided and the updated list that @carolyncole and @kevinreiss provided for the recap_edd: true, the mapping for the new recap locations and recap_edd:true is:
1. rcpgp -> recap$gp,  
2. rcpjq -> recap$jq
3. rcppa -> recap$pa
4. rcppb -> firestone$pb
5. rcppj -> marquand$pj
6. rcppk -> mendel$pk
7. rcppn -> lewis$pn
8. rcppq -> recap$pq
9. rcppt -> engineer$pt
10. rcppw -> arch$pw
11. rcpxw -> rare$xw
12. etasrcp -> online$etasrcp
13. scsbcul (partners not alma)
14. scsbnypl (partners not alma)
15. scsbhl (partners not alma)

This is a screenshot from my local:
![Screen Shot 2021-07-08 at 9 55 19 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9905193/125011866-3c095600-e037-11eb-8596-9341e609bb27.png)
There was a discussion with @kevinreiss about the holding_library column and if it's still needed or if we can remove it. It might be used in the requests gem. Something to look into.

@christinach I just noted that the holding library was no longer set for the new locations: https://github.com/pulibrary/requests/issues/1021. It is definitely causing bad behaviors to not have it.  I spot checked a couple of locations from your screen shot and they look the same as production bibdata (minus the names).
I was wondering if we can use location[:library][:code] since the name of the library and the holding_library is the same in the new locations.

But we can definitely keep it as it is having both 'library' and 'holding_library' and maybe do these changes in the future. 
My thought was more about that the holding_library as a concept does not apply any more in the new locations with remote_storage.
@christinach since we have to support both the old and the new locations currently, it would be simpler to keep it for now.  Then remove it after we go live and everything is in its new location.
I will keep the old recap locations to be safe; And we will remove them after we go live.
I agree, let's keep these through the migration to have a contingency if items don't migrate exactly as we think they should to the new remote_storage locations.

figgy.title: [Figgy/production] ActionView::Template::Error: bad URI(is not URI?): Newspaper Issue/

comments.body:
This issue is happening again: https://app.honeybadger.io/projects/53391/faults/55083926. Visiting the URL https://figgy.princeton.edu/catalog/92518d3e-f2b4-441a-889e-029f46911beb results in an error page

Error points to:

```
ActionView::Template::Error: bad URI(is not URI?): "investments,Foreign::Economics"

    ephemera_term_decorator.rb 24 internal_url(...)
    [PROJECT_ROOT]/app/resources/ephemera_terms/ephemera_term_decorator.rb:24:in `internal_url'

    return Array.wrap(model.uri).first if vocabulary.blank?
    vocabulary_uri = vocabulary.uri.to_s.end_with?("/") ? vocabulary.uri.to_s : vocabulary.uri.to_s + "/"
    URI.join(vocabulary_uri, URI.escape(camelized_label))
  end
```

orangelight.title: Updating requests to remove flood notice

comments.body:
[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/41251465/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/41251465)

Coverage increased (+0.08%) to 96.909% when pulling **44688b75fa46c45424252b4ecbd6fa41f48643c2 on issue_2431_holdings_for_constituent_records_v2** into **48fa9b25c59497052b7f9b7ca87d5c5ba5ae4b2d on alma**.
Is the location display right? It seems like it says "recap" a lot of times.

@hackartisan I am also curious about this. On my machine the host record shows the duplicate information (as shown in the screenshot) but in staging it shows correct: https://catalog-alma-qa.princeton.edu/catalog/99121886293506421. 

I am hoping the issue is with my locally indexed data (hence the duplicate in the host and the contained) but I am not 100% sure.

> @hackartisan I am also curious about this. On my machine the host record shows the duplicate information (as shown in the screenshot) but in staging it shows correct: https://catalog-alma-qa.princeton.edu/catalog/99121886293506421.
> 
> I am hoping the issue is with my locally indexed data (hence the duplicate in the host and the contained) but I am not 100% sure.

I can check the display locally and let you know as well.
